SEARCH
Package synapse

Class SynapseCamera

java.lang.Object
synapse.SynapseCamera
public class SynapseCamera extends Object
Represents a camera in the Synapse system, providing methods to manage settings and retrieve results from NetworkTables.

    • getPipeline

      public long getPipeline()
      Gets the current pipeline ID.
      Returns:
      The current pipeline ID, or -1 if not set.

    • getRecordingStatus

      public boolean getRecordingStatus()
      Gets the current recording status of the camera.
      Returns:
      True if the camera is recording, false otherwise.

    • setRecordStatus

      public void setRecordStatus(boolean status)
      Sets the recording status of the camera.
      Parameters:
      status - True to start recording, false to stop.

      Retrieves the camera ID.

    • getResults

      public <T> T getResults(SynapsePipeline<T> pipeline) throws IOException
      Fetches and deserializes the results for a given SynapsePipeline in a type-safe way.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The expected result type of the pipeline.
      Parameters:
      pipeline - The SynapsePipeline to fetch results from.
      Returns:
      The deserialized result.
      Throws:
      IOException - if reading or deserialization fails.

    • getResults

      public <T> T getResults(com.fasterxml.jackson.core.type.TypeReference<T> typeref, String typestring) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.exc.StreamReadException, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DatabindException, IOException
      Fetches and deserializes data from the NetworkTables results topic into the specified type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the object to deserialize.
      Parameters:
      typeref - The TypeReference describing the target type.
      typestring - The expected pipeline type string; used to validate the entry.
      Returns:
      An object of type T, deserialized from the raw NetworkTables data.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.exc.StreamReadException - If the input stream cannot be read properly.
      com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DatabindException - If there is a problem mapping the JSON bytes to the target type.
      IOException - If there is a low-level I/O problem accessing the NetworkTables data.

    • getResults

      public <T> T getResults(com.fasterxml.jackson.core.type.TypeReference<T> typeref, byte[] data) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.exc.StreamReadException, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DatabindException, IOException
      Deserializes the given byte array into an object of the specified type.

      This method supports both JSON and MessagePack formats, depending on the configured ObjectMapper.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the result object.
      Parameters:
      typeref - The TypeReference describing the expected type of the result.
      data - The serialized data as a byte array.
      Returns:
      An instance of type T deserialized from the provided data.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.exc.StreamReadException - If there is a low-level I/O or format problem while reading.
      com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DatabindException - If there is a problem mapping the data to the specified type.
      IOException - If a general I/O error occurs during deserialization.

    • getPipelineType

      public String getPipelineType()
      Gets the pipeline type string from the camera.
      Returns:
      The pipeline type string; "unknown" if not set.

      public Optional<Object> getSetting(String key)

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • setSetting

      public void setSetting(String key, double value) throws RuntimeException
      Sets a double setting value in the camera's settings table.
      Parameters:
      key - The setting key.
      value - The double value to set.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the setting type does not match.

    • isJUnitTest

      public static boolean isJUnitTest()
      Checks if the current code is running inside a unit test framework.

      This method inspects the current thread's stack trace and looks for class names associated with popular test frameworks, such as JUnit 4/5 and TestNG. If any stack frame indicates that a test framework is active, it returns true.

      Returns:
      true if the current code is executing inside a unit test, false otherwise
